The short answer to your question is that REST is not bound to HTTP.
To quote from Roy's dissertation:
"REST does not restrict communication to a particular protocol, but it does constrain the interface between components, and hence the scope of interaction and implementation assumptions that might otherwise be made between components ..." http://www1.ics.uci.edu/~fielding/pubs/dissertation/rest_arch_style.htm#sec_5_3_2 http://simplewebservices.org/index.php?title=Connector_View
There has, in fact, come up in conversation on [rest-discuss] very recently, see http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/rest-discuss/message/8781
